James outmuscled by hardy Halifax seconds

James firsts' chances of success in this year's College Cup suffered a blow this afternoon as they went down 2-1 to a physical Halifax seconds side (Thumbnail credit Image: Philippa Grafton)

Goals shared around as Wenty hit five

On the day that College Football stalwart Mark Eslick celebrated his birthday, and despite a valiant effort from Goodricke thirds, Wentworth seconds overpowered their opponents, hitting the back of the net five times without reply to seal a convincing win (Thumbnail credit Image: Philippa Grafton)

Cricket firsts hit the ground running with crushing victory over Northumbria

A ruthless knock of 75 by opener Fraser Crawford led York to a resounding victory against Northumbria Second XI, as the hosts made light work of the visitors' 116 (Thumbnail credit Wicket-keeper Andy Kirkwood celebrates the dismissal of Northumbria's Jonathan Weighill as York eased to a comfortable ten wicket victory. Photo: Peter Iveson)

Roses 2011: The White Rose's path to victory

By James Bithell

The weekend that all sportsmen and women at the University of York have been eagerly anticipating since October is just around the corner. The teams of York and Lancaster, from rugby to debating, will go head-to-head to compete for the Carter-James trophy

Cheerleaders pick up five national awards over successful Easter break

The York Hornets had a successful Easter holiday when they claimed first place at the British Cheerleading Association Midlands Classic. The victory backed up other impressive performances that included a runners-up spot at the University Nationals (Thumbnail credit The York Hornets in action during their first place at the BCAs over Easter. Photo credit: York Hornets)

BUCS season ends on a high for Uni teams

For the most part, the Easter break is a time to rest and relax at home after a long winter term, but for some of York's premier sportsmen and women it turned into a chance to gain York some valuable BUCS points (Thumbnail credit The men's lacrosse firsts were triumphiant in the Northern Conference Cup. Photo: Peter Iveson)

The trophy is anyone's to win after first week of fixtures fails to provide any conclusive answers

One week in and we are not yet able to alleviate the distinctly edgy atmosphere on the JLD. Each team is still feeling the pang of insecurity, and it is all the more acute for the contenders (Thumbnail credit Vanbrugh delight - joy of the cup. Photo: Philippa Grafton)

College Cup contenders start their campaigns as James set the pace

By James Bithell

Form and its more imperious cousin class aren't as far apart as usual when it comes to the College Cup. The confidence gained from a good start can gather momentum and before you know it the seconds striker reluctantly picked with budgetary constraints in mind becomes a hat-trick scoring behemoth (Thumbnail credit The Nouse XI who made the difference for their college, and for your fantasy team)

A tribute to Sir Henry Cooper

Graham Lilley remembers Sir Henry Cooper (Thumbnail credit Image: atomicShed via Flickr Creative Commons)

Five star Halifax show their class in victory over Derwent thirds

Halifax continued their strong start to the college cup with another win as they scored five without reply against Derwent's thirds

Green hat-trick helps Wentworth beat Goodricke

Dom Green notched up three superb finishes in Wentworth's second group match, and set his side on the road to recovery after their close defeat to Derwent last week

Rampant Halifax thirds the real deal as they demolish Langwith seconds

As the second week of competition began, Halifax thirds produced a superlative performance as they swept aside Langwith seconds in a stunning second half display

Alcuin firsts back to winning ways as they hammer Wentworth thirds

Two goals for man of the match Graham Kimber sealed a comfortable Alcuin firsts victory over Wentworth

Vanbrugh seconds march on unbeaten as they put three past James

Vanbrugh seconds cruised to a 3-1 win against James seconds and with a thoroughly convincing display

The Nouse Sport College Cup podcast

By James Bithell

After the first week of the College Cup the Nouse Sport team give their take on a good start for James, impressive performances all round for Halifax and examine the Fantasy Football standings

2011 Giro D'Italia Preview

Despite lacking some of the global prestige of the Tour de France, the Giro D'Italia often produces more gripping racing. With an almost ludicrously challenging route, and several of the world's greatest stage racers forgoing the Tour in order to focus on the Giro, this year's race promises to be another thrilling edition (Thumbnail credit Image: kwc via Flickr Creative Commons)

Seve Ballesteros 1957 - 2011

Sam Morgan remembers one of the most enduring figures in the world of sport (Thumbnail credit Image Credit: Peter vis Flickr Creative Commons)

Halifax firsts made to work for flattering five-goal victory

A hat-trick from UYAFC firsts captain Conor Brennan propelled Halifax firsts to a comfortable 5-0 win over wooden spoon favourites Wentworth thirds (Thumbnail credit Image: Philippa Grafton)

Last gasp Radford strike stuns Alcuin firsts

A last gasp equalizer from centre-back Dan Radford stunned cup holders Alcuin firsts as they were held to a 2-2 draw by Vanbrugh seconds on the opening day of their bid to retain the College Cup (Thumbnail credit Image: Philippa Grafton)

Garness and Gow secure shock win for Derwent thirds

Two goals from Jon Garness and another from John Gow secured Derwent thirds a mightily impressive 3-0 win against James seconds (Thumbnail credit Image: Philippa Grafton)

Kirk makes the difference as Derwent squeeze past Wentworth

A late goal from David Kirk allowed a below par Derwent firsts to clinch a 1-0 victory over a battling Wentworth firsts side in their first College Cup outing (Thumbnail credit Image: Peter Iveson)

Halifax thirds impress in draw with Goodricke seconds

Goodricke seconds and Halifax thirds fought out an entertaining and lively 1-1 draw on third day of the College Cup. (Thumbnail credit Image: Peter Iveson)

Langwith seconds stick three past Alcuin thirds

Headers from Callum Sheridan and Laurence Chetwynd, plus a last minute goal from Luke Holbrook, secured a comfortable 3-0 win for Langwith seconds over Alcuin thirds (Thumbnail credit Image: Peter Iveson)

The Secret Footballer

By James Bithell

This year Nouse have teamed up with a footballer, whose identity will be a closely guarded secret, to bring you a an exclusive insight into the world of the College Cup. Welcome to The Secret Footballer

Goodricke firsts docked two points for fielding ineligible player

Goodricke firsts, the winners of the Winter term College Football league, have been docked two points after fielding an ineligible player (Thumbnail credit Image: Philippa Grafton)

James thirds prove worthy challenge to eventual winners Goodricke firsts in fierce encounter

In a game characterised by aggression, appeals to the referee's decisions, and, at times, some brilliant football, Goodricke benefitted from goals by Ben Smith, Sam Astbury, and Luke Gutteridge to battle out a win over James thirds (Thumbnail credit Image: Philippa Grafton)

Early goals just sufficient to see Langwith firsts past Vanbrugh thirds

A spirited fight from Vanbrugh thirds in the second half was not enough to overturn two early goals which sealed three points for Langwith firsts in the opening of their college cup campaign (Thumbnail credit Image: Philippa Grafton)

Goals from Garness seal comfortable victory for Derwent seconds

n a rematch of last year's Plate final Derwent again overcame the challenge of Alcuin courtesy of two goals from Jon Garness. While the Derwent team boasted a number of players with experience from last year's triumph, Alcuin had a lot of new faces and Derwent drew on this to expose their lack of cohesion (Thumbnail credit Image: Philippa Grafton)

Mcleod the difference in heated encounter between James and Vanbrugh

A bad tempered encounter between two of the sides fancied to lift this year's College Cup trophy was won by James, thanks in no small part to a sterling display from Mark Mcleod and two goals from James Offord (Thumbnail credit Image: Justyn Hardcastle)

Denham brace does enough to see off Goodricke thirds

Goodricke thirds fought hard against a talented Halifax seconds side but were helpless to prevent a brace from Hamish Denham as Harry Pearson's side got their College Cup campaign off with a victory (Thumbnail credit Image: Justyn Hardcastle)

James outmuscled by hardy Halifax seconds

James firsts' chances of success in this year's College Cup suffered a blow this afternoon as they went down 2-1 to a physical Halifax seconds side (Thumbnail credit Image: Philippa Grafton)
